intro: Belloa santanica, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Belloa santanica is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
